properties.name: 20th Street Stairs
properties.description: Posted by Ludmilla 20th and Sanchez, San Francisco, CA 94114Some of my favorite stairs are located between Sanchez and Noe. Great views, and some lovely older architecture. (with thanks to sisterbetty.org)

properties.name: Belden Place
properties.description: Posted by Ludmilla 44 Belden Place, San Francisco, CA 94108A blocklong alley just east of Kearny, linking Bush and Pine streets, a number of good restaurants and cafe\'s have tranformed this alley into an urban alfresco treat with a french feeling - especially pleasant on warm nights. On Belden place are: Cafe Bastille, Plouf, B44, Sam\'s, Cafe Tiramisu, Cafe 52, Voda...

properties.name: Calamity Jane was born here in 1852
properties.description: Posted by Ludmilla Princeton, MissouriDaring female scout Calamaty Jane (Mary Burke) was born in Princeton Missouri, but didn\'t stay put for very long. more here: http://www.cowgirls.com/dream/cowgals/calamity.htm

properties.name: Carolina St Stairs, Potrero Hill
properties.description: Posted by Ludmilla Carolina and 20th, San Francisco, CA 94107steep half-block set of steps that links the dead-end of Carolina St to 20th St. shadey, with nice views.

properties.name: Chez Maman
properties.description: Posted by System 1453 18th Street, San Francisco, CA, 94107Chez Maman 415-824-7166

properties.name: Giant Sundial
properties.description: Posted by LudmillaBuilt in 1913 as part of a developement on the site of an old racetrack (Urbano Dr. retains the shape of the track). For a long time this gnomon was known as the world\'s largest.

properties.name: Hearst Castle
properties.description: Posted by LudmillaJuila Morgan\'s masterpiece of California architecture houses a fabulous collection of art, and you can tell it\'s a hell of a party house. Not at all over-rated.

properties.name: Laci
properties.description: Posted by Ludmilla 2982 Adeline St., Berkeley, CA 94703in addition to a fine museum of lacework and textiles, this is the shop for all those little things for the well-appointed costumer\'s atelier, or the aficionado of vintage couture and handcrafted beautiful things. where else can you find a chatelaine, knitting needles, pewter clasps, lace trimmings, books an accessories, all in one spot?

properties.name: Magdelene Asylum Meditation Grotto
properties.description: Posted by LudmillaIN an unlikely spot at the entrance to the SF Mental Health Rehabilitation Center (next to SF General Hospital) is a little man-made marble grotto, with an altar. Site of an old asylum. It\'s a very special place.

properties.name: Mitchell's Ice Cream
properties.description: Posted by Ludmilla 688 San Jose Avenue, San Francisco, CA, 94110Ice creamery with special Pacific inspired flavors: 6 different kinds of coconut, mango, etc.

properties.name: Mrs Dewson's Hats
properties.description: Posted by System2050 Fillmore St, San Francisco, CAMrs Dewson\'s Hats (415) 346-1600

properties.name: Peralta Stairs, Bernal Heights
properties.description: Posted by Ludmilla 10 Peralta Ave, San Francisco, CA 94110This is a steep and trecherous stairway connecting the first block of Peralta Ave with Cesar Chavez below. Great place for views and mooning people on the freeway.

properties.name: Tail of the Yak Trading Co.
properties.description: Posted by Ludmilla Lovely shop full of decorative art, housewares and gifts, unusual and antique jewelry and everything ethereal and beautiful!

properties.name: The Ribbonerie
properties.description: Posted by Ludmilla 191 Potrero Ave, San Francisco, CA 94103a shop full of the most wonderful ribbons in the world, for costumers, milliners, etc.

properties.name: Tsui Shell House
properties.description: Posted by Ludmilla 2747 Mathews St, Berkeley, CA 94702groovy modern house built like a shell.

properties.name: Vermont Street steps
properties.description: Posted by Ludmillavermont st, san francisco, canext the the real crookedest street in the city, several sets of steps make for a hearty climb up to a park with a great view of 101 and beyond.

properties.name: blow job with a view
properties.description: Posted by Ludmillabeautiful crystal clear night in december, we parked in the marin headlands.

properties.name: coastal redwoods and a vw rabbit
properties.description: Posted by Ludmilla Eureka, cahe was an exchange student from england, and we were driving from berkeley to portland, oregon. he had never seen giant redwoods before. my car had a sunroof, and every few seconds one of us would say, "wow, look at the trees!"

properties.name: lost an earring having sex by the train tracks
properties.description: Posted by Ludmillai picked him up at club mallard on san pablo. we drove out to the train tracks and had sex in and around his car. i lost one of my favorite earrings there.

properties.name: ocean view nookie
properties.description: Posted by Ludmilla driving up 101 after going to gaviota beach and swimming in our underwear, we pulled over on a rough access road and parked where we had a view of the ocean, and had sex on the hot black hood of the car.

properties.name: the city gives out tickets on a stinkie street they never clean
properties.description: Posted by Ludmillahow could i tell it was a hydrant - i thought it was a bush. it doesn\'t work, all its fitting are broken off and there is a bush growing out of it. people sleep in their cars and motor homes on this block and stay there for weeks at a time. i found a poor dead smelly dog under a pile of cardboard right on this corner. there is so much poop and trash and broken glass on this block that i wonder how the city can dare fine me 00 for having parked here.
